intro: Mimosa lewisii, commonly known as the pink mimosinha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant has a shallow root system and thrives in sandy or rocky soils, often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. It is known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize areas quickly, making it an important pioneer species in ecological succession. The plant also has a unique response to touch, causing its leaves to fold shut when disturbed.
